elements.content:
We report a novel bright deep-blue-emitting crystal form based on a simple cadmium coordination polymer with an impressive external photoluminescence quantum yield of 75.4(9)%.

This Communication was inadvertently published prior to the final revision of the manuscript. The title, text, and Supporting Information have been revised to clarify the discussions related to the PLQY, and two new references are included. The revised version was re-posted on February 14, 2019.
elements.clean_text:
We report a novel bright deep-blue-emitting crystal form based on a simple cadmium coordination polymer with an impressive external photoluminescence quantum yield of 75.4(9)%.

This Communication was inadvertently published prior to the final revision of the manuscript. The title, text, and Supporting Information have been revised to clarify the discussions related to the PLQY, and two new references are included. The revised version was re-posted on February 14, 2019.

elements.content: Organic light-emitting devices (OLEDs) as solid-state light sources have meant the enterprise of display technologies. In this context, the search for new light-emitting materials in the solid state with maximum external photoluminescence quantum yield (PLQY) in the visible spectral range is crucial to improve the performance of electronic devices and has attracted the interest of many chemists at materials and electronics companies. The external PLQY is defined as the ratio of the number of emitted photons to the total number of incident photons over the material, while the internal PLQY is the ratio of the number of emitted photons to the number of photons absorbed by the material. Therefore, since high internal PLQY can be associated with low absorption, the external PLQY of a light emitter dictates its applicability to OLEDs for practical uses. In this context, photoluminescence assessment is the first step in the screening of such new promising candidates. Lately, heavy-metal complexes have been extensively explored in order to obtain high internal PLQY in the solid state, approaching 100%.
elements.clean_text: Organic light-emitting devices (OLEDs) as solid-state light sources have meant the enterprise of display technologies. In this context, the search for new light-emitting materials in the solid state with maximum external photoluminescence quantum yield (PLQY) in the visible spectral range is crucial to improve the performance of electronic devices and has attracted the interest of many chemists at materials and electronics companies. The external PLQY is defined as the ratio of the number of emitted photons to the total number of incident photons over the material, while the internal PLQY is the ratio of the number of emitted photons to the number of photons absorbed by the material. Therefore, since high internal PLQY can be associated with low absorption, the external PLQY of a light emitter dictates its applicability to OLEDs for practical uses. In this context, photoluminescence assessment is the first step in the screening of such new promising candidates. Lately, heavy-metal complexes have been extensively explored in order to obtain high internal PLQY in the solid state, approaching 100%.

elements.content: Here we report a novel bright deep-blue-emitting crystal form based on a simple cadmium coordination polymer with an impressive external PLQY of 75.4%. Furthermore, its quantitative synthesis is achieved at room temperature in one solution preparation step needing only low-cost reagents {cadmium acetate dihydrate [Cd­(AcO)2·2H2O] and aminopyrazine (ampyz) in an equimolar ratio} and vehicle (ethyl alcohol), followed by slow vehicle evaporation and isolation of the monophasic crystalline product, adding still more attractive advantages to this material. Its synthesis and characterization are provided in the Supporting Information.
elements.clean_text: Here we report a novel bright deep-blue-emitting crystal form based on a simple cadmium coordination polymer with an impressive external PLQY of 75.4%. Furthermore, its quantitative synthesis is achieved at room temperature in one solution preparation step needing only low-cost reagents {cadmium acetate dihydrate [Cd(AcO)2⋅2H2O] and aminopyrazine (ampyz) in an equimolar ratio} and vehicle (ethyl alcohol), followed by slow vehicle evaporation and isolation of the monophasic crystalline product, adding still more attractive advantages to this material. Its synthesis and characterization are provided in the Supporting Information.

elements.content: The complex [Cd­(ampyz)­(AcO)2(H2O)] n (1) is an infinite 1D coordination polymer made up of Cd2+ transition metal ions spaced by 7.5660(5) Å through an ampyz (). Each Cd2+ center is seven-coordinated by two nitrogens from two bidentate ampyz molecules, four oxygens from two bidentate acetate anions, and one oxygen atom from one water molecule. Its coordination geometry can be described as a somewhat distorted pentagonal bipyramid, with oxygens forming the distorted basal plane [root-mean-square deviation (RMSD) of 0.272 Å from the least-squares plane calculated through them] and the nitrogens occupying the axial positions. Therefore, the acetates are almost perpendicular to ampyz. The mean plane calculated through non-hydrogen pyrazine atoms forms angles of 82.9(2)° and 85.52(18)° with those of acetates. The O–CdO bond angles around the metal ion range from 53.55(8)° (oxygens from the same acetate) to 138.11(4)° (oxygens from different acetates), while the N–CdN angle measures 175.33(12)°. The Cd–Oacet coordination bonds range between 2.361(2) and 2.464(2) Å, while the Cd–Ow one measures 2.273(3) Å. The Cd–Nampyz coordination bonds measure 2.397(3) Å.
elements.clean_text: The complex [Cd(ampyz)(AcO)2(H2O)] n  (1) is an infinite 1D coordination polymer made up of Cd2+ transition metal ions spaced by 7.5660(5) Å through an ampyz (). Each Cd2+ center is seven-coordinated by two nitrogens from two bidentate ampyz molecules, four oxygens from two bidentate acetate anions, and one oxygen atom from one water molecule. Its coordination geometry can be described as a somewhat distorted pentagonal bipyramid, with oxygens forming the distorted basal plane [root-mean-square deviation (RMSD) of 0.272 Å from the least-squares plane calculated through them] and the nitrogens occupying the axial positions. Therefore, the acetates are almost perpendicular to ampyz. The mean plane calculated through non-hydrogen pyrazine atoms forms angles of 82.9(2)° and 85.52(18)° with those of acetates. The O-CdO bond angles around the metal ion range from 53.55(8)° (oxygens from the same acetate) to 138.11(4)° (oxygens from different acetates), while the N-CdN angle measures 175.33(12)°. The Cd-Oacet coordination bonds range between 2.361(2) and 2.464(2) Å, while the Cd-Ow one measures 2.273(3) Å. The Cd-Nampyz coordination bonds measure 2.397(3) Å.

elements.content: Crystal structure of 1. Cyan dashed lines outline hydrogen bonds. CH hydrogens and the NH2 group fraction with 47.4(2)% occupancy, which is bonded to carbon vicinal to that holding the shown 52.6(2)% NH2 sites, have been omitted for clarity.
elements.clean_text: 1  Crystal structure of 1. Cyan dashed lines outline hydrogen bonds. CH hydrogens and the NH2 group fraction with 47.4(2)% occupancy, which is bonded to carbon vicinal to that holding the shown 52.6(2)% NH2 sites, have been omitted for clarity.

elements.content: As aforementioned, this complex can be described as a polymeric structure formed by [Cd­(ampyz)­(AcO)2(H2O)] n units, which can be expanded by means of the Cd–N coordination bond (). Furthermore, all of the hydrogen-bonding functionalities are saturated in this structure. There are two classical intramolecular hydrogen bonds between the amino group and acetates. The amino group is also an intermolecular hydrogen-bonding donor to another acetate anion from a neighboring chain packed perpendicular to [010] with a rise of 2.15 Å normal to [201] (). Even though the amino group is disordered over two occupancy site sets, both of them have the same pattern of contacts with slight differences in their metrics, as reflected in their similar refined site occupancy factors [52.6(2)% and 47.4(2)%]. Polymeric chains packed perpendicular to [010] are also strongly kept in contact through hydrogen bonds between water and acetate ligands, which propagate infinitely along [001] (). These two patterns of intermolecular hydrogen bonds bearing either amino groups or water as donors to acetate ligands alternate perpendicular to [010] and give rise to a 3D network of strongly hydrogen-bonded polymeric chains.
elements.clean_text: As aforementioned, this complex can be described as a polymeric structure formed by [Cd(ampyz)(AcO)2(H2O)] n  units, which can be expanded by means of the Cd-N coordination bond (). Furthermore, all of the hydrogen-bonding functionalities are saturated in this structure. There are two classical intramolecular hydrogen bonds between the amino group and acetates. The amino group is also an intermolecular hydrogen-bonding donor to another acetate anion from a neighboring chain packed perpendicular to [010] with a rise of 2.15 Å normal to [201] (). Even though the amino group is disordered over two occupancy site sets, both of them have the same pattern of contacts with slight differences in their metrics, as reflected in their similar refined site occupancy factors [52.6(2)% and 47.4(2)%]. Polymeric chains packed perpendicular to [010] are also strongly kept in contact through hydrogen bonds between water and acetate ligands, which propagate infinitely along [001] (). These two patterns of intermolecular hydrogen bonds bearing either amino groups or water as donors to acetate ligands alternate perpendicular to [010] and give rise to a 3D network of strongly hydrogen-bonded polymeric chains.

elements.content: Excitation and photoluminescence (PL) emission spectra of 1 are shown in a. The excitation spectrum was acquired by monitoring the emission band at 402 nm and consists of a broad band in the UV region with two maxima at 275 and 365 nm, which is well-correlated with the diffuse-reflectance spectrum (DRS) presenting two absorption bands centered at 270 and 370 nm (a). The diffuse reflectance is higher than 80% for wavelengths above 410 nm. The strong PL emission spectrum upon excitation with a 365 nm UV light consists of a wide band with maximum centered at 402 nm, corresponding to a deep-blue color (colorimetric coordinates x = 0.167 and y = 0.037; b). The colorimetric coordinates of our sample are included in the CIE 1931 chromaticity diagram in b.
elements.clean_text: Excitation and photoluminescence (PL) emission spectra of 1 are shown in a. The excitation spectrum was acquired by monitoring the emission band at 402 nm and consists of a broad band in the UV region with two maxima at 275 and 365 nm, which is well-correlated with the diffuse-reflectance spectrum (DRS) presenting two absorption bands centered at 270 and 370 nm (a). The diffuse reflectance is higher than 80% for wavelengths above 410 nm. The strong PL emission spectrum upon excitation with a 365 nm UV light consists of a wide band with maximum centered at 402 nm, corresponding to a deep-blue color (colorimetric coordinates x = 0.167 and y = 0.037; b). The colorimetric coordinates of our sample are included in the CIE 1931 chromaticity diagram in b.

elements.content: (a) Excitation, emission, and diffuse-reflectance spectra of 1. The inset photograph shows two penicillin-type vials with ca. 35 mg each within a UV chamber. (b) CIE 1931 color coordinates of the PL emission, represented by the white circle.
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) Excitation, emission, and diffuse-reflectance spectra of 1. The inset photograph shows two penicillin-type vials with ca. 35 mg each within a UV chamber. (b) CIE 1931 color coordinates of the PL emission, represented by the white circle.

elements.content: An impressive external PLQY of 75.4(9)% was observed, with a corresponding internal PLQY of 77.7(9)%. To the best of our knowledge, an external PLQY of 58.5% has been achieved for orange-red phosphorescent nitridosilicates, while a blue-light-emitting surface-anchored metal−organic framework exhibited external PLQY of 8%.
elements.clean_text: An impressive external PLQY of 75.4(9)% was observed, with a corresponding internal PLQY of 77.7(9)%. To the best of our knowledge, an external PLQY of 58.5% has been achieved for orange-red phosphorescent nitridosilicates, while a blue-light-emitting surface-anchored metal-organic framework exhibited external PLQY of 8%.

elements.content: The decay of the excited state (ES) recorded at room temperature is shown in . The ES population exhibits a biexponential decay with lifetimes of 10.04(2) ns (92.96%) and 190(7) ns (7.04%). This observed decay behavior could be caused by different triplet sublevels within the same ES (due to spin–orbit coupling) or different emissive levels as found in our TD-DFT calculations.
elements.clean_text: The decay of the excited state (ES) recorded at room temperature is shown in . The ES population exhibits a biexponential decay with lifetimes of 10.04(2) ns (92.96%) and 190(7) ns (7.04%). This observed decay behavior could be caused by different triplet sublevels within the same ES (due to spin-orbit coupling) or different emissive levels as found in our TD-DFT calculations.

elements.content: ES decay profile of 1.

In order to shed some light on the unexpected extremely high external PLQY of our material, TD-DFT spectra were computed with different basis sets (def2-SVP, def2-TZVP) and exchange correlation functionals (B3LYP, cam-B3LYP, M06-2X). A model consisting of one Cd atom and its ligands was used in the calculations, with optimization of hydrogens only, at all levels of theory. Likewise, a larger model with four of the above units, extracted from the crystal structure to have all possible intermolecular hydrogen bonds, as shown in Figure S1, was also input into the calculations. All of the calculations show four electronic transitions for the experimental absorption band at 365 nm, except those using the B3LYP exchange–correlation functional. It is well-known that the M06-2X exchange–correlation functional describes hydrogen bonds more accurately. Therefore, through the use of this functional and cam-B3LYP in the TD-DFT calculations, the transitions with the largest oscillator strengths in the 365 nm region correspond to HOMO/HOMO–1 to LUMO, followed by those from HOMO/HOMO–1 to LUMO+1 (). The HOMO and HOMO–1 are almost degenerate with similar shapes, being mainly distinguished from each other by a phase difference. In both the HOMO and HOMO–1, the wave function is spread over the two ampyz ligands, while the LUMO and LUMO+1 are localized over just one of them. Therefore, the main transitions related to the high external PLQY of our material are due to a high-efficiency delocalization-to-localization charge transition phenomenon.
elements.clean_text: In order to shed some light on the unexpected extremely high external PLQY of our material, TD-DFT spectra were computed with different basis sets (def2-SVP, def2-TZVP) and exchange correlation functionals (B3LYP, cam-B3LYP, M06-2X). A model consisting of one Cd atom and its ligands was used in the calculations, with optimization of hydrogens only, at all levels of theory. Likewise, a larger model with four of the above units, extracted from the crystal structure to have all possible intermolecular hydrogen bonds, as shown in Figure S1, was also input into the calculations. All of the calculations show four electronic transitions for the experimental absorption band at 365 nm, except those using the B3LYP exchange-correlation functional. It is well-known that the M06-2X exchange-correlation functional describes hydrogen bonds more accurately. Therefore, through the use of this functional and cam-B3LYP in the TD-DFT calculations, the transitions with the largest oscillator strengths in the 365 nm region correspond to HOMO/HOMO-1 to LUMO, followed by those from HOMO/HOMO-1 to LUMO+1 (). The HOMO and HOMO-1 are almost degenerate with similar shapes, being mainly distinguished from each other by a phase difference. In both the HOMO and HOMO-1, the wave function is spread over the two ampyz ligands, while the LUMO and LUMO+1 are localized over just one of them. Therefore, the main transitions related to the high external PLQY of our material are due to a high-efficiency delocalization-to-localization charge transition phenomenon.

elements.content: Experimental excitation and TD-DFT spectra calculated with different basis sets and exchange correlation functionals for one Cd2+ and its ligands (only hydrogens optimized; the model is shown at the top). Black dot-dashed curve, experimental; yellow curve, TD-DFT/B3LYP/def2-TZVP; red curve, TD-DFT/cam-B3LYP/def2-SVP; green curve, TD-DFT/cam-B3LYP/def2-TZVP; blue curve, TD-DFT/M06-2X/def2-SVP; purple curve, TD-DFT/M06-2X/def2-TZVP. TD-DFT/M06-2X/def2-SVP calculations for a larger model including interchain hydrogen bonds (Figure S1) were also performed with H optimization only (magenta curve) or full optimization (orange curve).
elements.clean_text: 4  Experimental excitation and TD-DFT spectra calculated with different basis sets and exchange correlation functionals for one Cd2+ and its ligands (only hydrogens optimized; the model is shown at the top). Black dot-dashed curve, experimental; yellow curve, TD-DFT/B3LYP/def2-TZVP; red curve, TD-DFT/cam-B3LYP/def2-SVP; green curve, TD-DFT/cam-B3LYP/def2-TZVP; blue curve, TD-DFT/M06-2X/def2-SVP; purple curve, TD-DFT/M06-2X/def2-TZVP. TD-DFT/M06-2X/def2-SVP calculations for a larger model including interchain hydrogen bonds (Figure S1) were also performed with H optimization only (magenta curve) or full optimization (orange curve).

elements.content: In summary, we have discovered a solid-state material with a high energy conversion rate from UV to visible light. The next steps will consist of fabricating high-performance blue OLED devices with this crystal form and further exploring its fascinating optical property.
elements.clean_text: In summary, we have discovered a solid-state material with a high energy conversion rate from UV to visible light. The next steps will consist of fabricating high-performance blue OLED devices with this crystal form and further exploring its fascinating optical property.

metadata.title:
A Blue-Light-Emitting
Cadmium Coordination Polymer
with 75.4% Photoluminescence Quantum Yield
